a1: Body Mass Index (BMI) is a measure calculated from your height and weight. It provides a general indication of whether you are underweight, normal weight, overweight, or obese.
a2: BMI = weight (kg) / height (m)². For imperial units, it is weight (lbs) × 703 / height (in)².
a4: BMI is a screening tool and may not be accurate for athletes, elderly, or pregnant women. It does not measure body fat directly.
a5: No. All calculations run in your browser. No data is sent to any server or stored anywhere.
